newsitem.title: EU: REUTER EC REPORT LONG-TERM DIARY (PAGE 2/10 - MAR 20-APR 6).
newsitem.headline: REUTER EC REPORT LONG-TERM DIARY (PAGE 2/10 - MAR 20-APR 6).

text.p: EC Report Long-Term Diary (page 4/10 - Apr 24-May 19). THURSDAY, MARCH 20
BRUSSELS - (possibly) EP and Council Conciliation Committee meets on directive amending the existing directive on "Television without frontiers". Venue: EP.
BRUSSELS (EXPANDED ITEM) - Economic and Social Committee (ECOSOC) plenary session continues (second of two days).

BRUSSELS (NEW ITEM) - British Midland Chairman holds news conference on "The completion of the European Commission's aviation reforms" (1015/0915 GMT). Venue: Le Meridien Hotel. Contact: An Vandenberghe by fax (322) 732 1394.

BRUSSELS (NEW ITEM) - Katholieke Universiteit Brussel (KU) holds international relations lecture on "A durable security for the new Europe: Russia's role" (2000/1900 GMT). Speaker is Russian Ambassador Vitaly Churkin. Venue: KU Brussels. Contact: KU (322) 412 4211.

BRUSSELS - Euromanagement holds conference on "Industrial water management" (To March 21). The conference aims to help industry improve its water and wastewater management. Contact: Gabrielle Smit, Euromanagement (31) 40 297 4944.
HELSINKI (NEW ITEM) - Russian President Boris Yelstin and U.S. President Bill Clinton hold summit; discussions focus on NATO future and enlargement.
FRIDAY MARCH 21

BRUSSELS (NEW ITEM) - EU-Japan Centre for Industrial Cooperation European Office holds seminar on "New business opportunities in Central and Eastern Europe for European and Japanese companies" (1400/1300 GMT). Venue: Hilton Hotel. Contact: EU-Japan Centre for Industrial Cooperation European Office (322) 282 0040.

BRUSSELS (NEW ITEM) - Railforum Nederland and Deutsches Verkehrsforum hold joint conference on "Railway frontiers in a frontier-free Europe" (0930/0830 GMT). Speakers include: European Commissioner Kinnock. Venue: Sheraton Hotel. Contact: Irmgard Kirsten, Deutsches Verkehrsforum (49) 228 98 554 20.

DUBLIN (NEW ITEM) - Institute of European Affairs (IEA) holds conference on "The inter-governmental conference and Ireland's strategic interests: flexibility, institutional reform and the third pillar" (1400/1400 GMT). Venue: IEA, 8 North Great George's stree. Contact: IEA (353) 1 874 6756.
TOULOUSE, France - Institut Superieur de Recherche pour l'Europe holds seminar on "The inter-governmental conference (IGC)". Contact: Institut Superieur de Recherche pour l'Europe (33) 5 61 52 7375.
MONDAY, MARCH 24
BRUSSELS - General Affairs Council (To March 25).
Provisional agenda includes:
- Former Yugoslavia.
- Albania: report of EU mission.
- Middle East peace process.
- Relations with Turkey: preparation of Association Council.
- Trade questions, including:
- Conclusion of an Information Technology Agreement;
- (possibly) WTO panel on Helms-Burton legislation.
- Relations with South Africa:
- State of negotiations on a cooperation agreement;
- Protocol of accession to the Lome Convention.
- Mediterranean policy:
- Preparation of 2nd Ministerial meeting (Barcelona process) (15-16 April 1997);
- State of negotiations with Egypt, Lebanon, Jordan and Algeria.
- Russia.
- Association Council with Romania: determination of the Union's position.
- Preparation of the structured dialogue meeting with the Central and Eastern European Countries (CEECs).
- VII ministerial meeting, EU-Rio Group: determination of the Union's position.
- In the margins of the Council:
- Association Council with Romania;
- Structured dialogue meeting with the CEECs.

BRUSSELS (NEW ITEM) - Centre for European Policy Studies (CEPS) holds lunchtime seminar on "Future perspective for the European social fund" (1315/1215 GMT). Speaker is European Commissioner Flynn. Venue: CEPS. Contact: CEPS (322) 229 3911.

BRUSSELS - British Chamber of Commerce in Belgium holds debate on "EU competition policy - Third party rights - Use or abuse?" (1730/1630 GMT). Venue: Meridien Hotel. Contact: British Chamber of Commerce in Belgium (322) 540 9030.
TUESDAY, MARCH 25
ROME (EXPANDED ITEM) - EU foreign ministers hold special conclave to commemorate the 40th anniversary of the 1957 Treaty of Rome.
Agenda includes:
- (1000/0900 GMT) The state of the inter-governmental conference (IGC).
- (NEW ITEM) - (1240/1140 GMT) Italian inter-governmental conference representative Fagiolo holds news conference on the outcome of the meeting.
- (1300/1200 GMT) Prime Minister Romano Prodi and European Commission President Santer hold joint news conference on the outcome of the General Affairs Council meeting.
- (1345/1245 GMT) Lunch hosted by Italian President Oscar Luigi Scalfaro.
- (1600/1500 GMT) Official commemoration ceremony of the 40th anniversary of the 1957 Treaty of Rome.
- (1700/1600 GMT) EP President Jose Maria Gil-Robles, Dutch Foreign Minister Hans van Mierlo and European Commission President Santer hold joint news conference following the ceremony.
- (1730/1630 GMT) Commission meeting.
- (1730/1630 GMT) National parliament presidents meet.
- (2000/1900 GMT) Rome mayor hosts reception.
BRUSSELS - EU Monetary Committee meets (1000/0900 GMT).

LUXEMBOURG (NEW ITEM) - European Commission hosts conference on "Mobility and occupational pension schemes in Europe" (0900/0800 GMT). Venue: Jean Monnet building, room M4. Contact: Uniglobe (322) 267 4183.
FRIDAY, MARCH 28
- EU institutions closed for Easter holidays to March 31 inclusive.
APRIL
BRUSSELS - Bosnian donor countries hold conference to discuss future of former Yugoslavia.
FRIDAY, APRIL 4

NOORDWIJK, Netherlands - Informal ECOFIN Council (To April 6). (possibly) Discussions focus on regulations for EMU stability pact, legal framework and ERM 2. Ministers will look at designs for euro coin ahead of formal decision by EU leaders in June.
SUNDAY, APRIL 6
MAASTRICHT - Informal Cultural Affairs Council (To April 8). No agenda yet available. Reuter EC Report Long-Term Diary (page 3/10 - Apr 7-23)
MONDAY, APRIL 7
NOORDWIJK - EU-Rio Group meeting involving South American countries and Mexico, Panama, Trinidad, Tobago and Costa Rica (To April 8).
STRASBOURG - European Parliament holds plenary session (To April 11).
BONN - European Commission hosts first annual electronic commerce conference "G7 - Global marketplace for SMEs project" (To April 9). Contact: Sandra Helms, Empirica GmbH (49) 228 985 3888.
SALZBURG (NEW ITEM) - ACI Europe holds conference on airport development and evironment issues (To April 9). Contact: Yevgeny Pogorelov (322) 552 0982.
BERLIN - International European Training Centre holds seminar on "Building Europe: EU enlargement and deepening". Contact: International European Training Centre (33) 4 92 15 2121.
WEDNESDAY, APRIL 9
THE HAGUE - Dutch EU presidency hosts ministerial conference on social integration (To April 11).
THURSDAY, APRIL 10
LUXEMBOURG - Consumers Council.
Provisional agenda includes:
- Voluntary agreements as important instruments for consumer policy - Council resolution.
- Proposal for an EP and Council directive on injunctions for the protection of consumer interests.

- Proposal for an EP and Council directive amending directive 87/102/EEC (as amended by Directive 90/88/EEC) for the approximation of the laws, regulations and administrative provisions of the Member States concerning consumer credit.
- (possibly) Report of the Commission on the application of directive 87/012/EEC concerning consumer credit.
- Proposal for an EP and Council directive on the sale of consumer goods and associated guarantees.

BRUSSELS (NEW ITEM) - British Chamber of Commerce in Belgium holds annual banquet (1900/1800 GMT). European Commissioner Kinnock attends. Venue: Hilton Hotel. Contact: British Chamber of Commerce (322) 540 9030.
FRIDAY, APRIL 11
VENICE, Italy (NEW ITEM) - First scientific congress to review measures taken by the EU to restore consumer confidence in beef after the mad cow crisis (To April 12).

LONDON - The Royal Institute of International Affairs holds conference on "Trade and environment: conflict or compatibility?". Sessions include: trade and environment after Singapore; trade versus environment - the evidence; industry concerns; resolving trade and environment disputes; the future. Speakers include: European Commissioner Brittan. Venue: Chatham House, 10 St James Square. Contact: Sharon Moore (44) 171 957 5700.
MONDAY, APRIL 14
LUXEMBOURG - Fisheries Council (To April 15).
Provisional agenda includes:
- Council decision on Multiannual Guidance Programmes (Structural arrangements for 1997-1999).
- (possibly) Proposal for a Council regulation laying down certain technical measures for the conservation of fisheries resources.
- Proposal for a Council decision on a specific measure to encourage Italian fishermen to diversify out of certain fishing activities.
- (possibly) Communication from the Commission to Council and EP on fisheries agreements (Present situation and future prospects).
- (possibly) Proposal for a Council regulation allocating among Member States, for 1997, Community fish quotas of Atlanto-Scandian herring and horse mackerel.
- (possibly) Accession of Community to General Fisheries Council for the Mediterranean.
- (possibly) Consultations with Norway on a new management regime for North Sea herring.
- (possibly) Consultations with Norway on a new management regime for mackerel.
- Proposal for a Council regulation providing for the opening and management of autonomous Community tariff quotas for certain fisheries products (1997).
TUESDAY, APRIL 15
VALETTA, Malta (NEW ITEM) - EU and Mediterranean ministers attend Euro-Med conference in a follow-up to the 1995 Barcelona conference (To April 16)
WEDNESDAY, APRIL 16
BRUSSELS - Aeronautica holds "European air transport conference" (To April 17). Venue: Sheraton Towers. Contact: Aeronautica (44) 181 893 3795.
THURSDAY, APRIL 17
LUXEMBOURG - Social Affairs Council.
Provisional agenda includes:
- Employment and Labour Market Committee.
- Modified proposal for a directive on "Chemical Agents".
- Worker information and consultation.
- (possibly) Commission activities on analysis, research, cooperation and action in the field of employment.
- (possibly) Directive modifying directive 90/394/CEE concerning the protection of workers from the risks related to exposure to carcinogens at work.
- (possibly) New communication on the future of social protection.
- (possibly) White Paper on working time in excluded sectors.
- Proposal for a directive: "Burden of proof in cases of discrimination based on sex".

- Proposal for a directive amending directive 76/207/EEC on the implementation of the principle of equal treatment for men and women as regards access to employment, vocational training and promotion, and working conditions (Kalanke Ruling).
- Collective redundancies (Codification).
- Council Recommendation on home working.
MAASTRICHT - Dutch EU presidency hosts post-Lome ministerial meeting (April 18).

BRUSSELS (NEW ITEM) - Katholieke Universiteit Brussel (KU) holds international relations lecture on "Mixed signals: Central bank independence, wage bargaining". Speaker is Harvard University Government Professor Peter Hall. Venue: KU Brussels. Contact: KU (322) 412 4211.
FRIDAY, APRIL 18
AMSTERDAM - Informal Environment Council (To April 20). No agenda yet available.
MONDAY, APRIL 21
LUXEMBOURG - Farm Council (To April 22). No agenda yet available.

MALTA - European Documentation and Research Centre (EDRC) and University of Malta hold conference on "The State of the European Union Conference 1997". Discussions focus on the development of EU policies especially with regard to the EU citizens' ombudsman; the evolution of cooperation on justice and home affairs in Europe; EU social policy; EU initiatives for employment and growth and the EU's SME policy. Contact: Monica Cauchi, EDRC (356) 32 90 20 01.
TUESDAY, APRIL 22
BRUSSELS - EU Monetary Committee meets (1000/0900 GMT).
WEDNESDAY, APRIL 23
BRUSSELS - Economic and Social Committee (ECOSOC) holds plenary session (To April 24).
BRUSSELS - European Parliament holds mini session (To April 24).
THURSDAY, APRIL 24
LUXEMBOURG - Industry Council.
Provisional agenda includes:
- Shipbuilding:
a) (possibly) Individual cases of state aid;
b) Future of Community policy on state aid in connection with the situation regarding ratifications of the OECD Aereement.
- Competitiveness of the European industry - Report by the Commission.
- State Aid:
- 5th Survey report on state aid by the Commission;
- State of affairs regarding proposals related to art. 94 of the Treaty.
- (possibly) Action programme in the field of the Information Society.
LUXEMBOURG - EU-ACP (African, Caribbean and Pacific countries) Council (To April 25). No agenda yet available.
THE HAGUE - Dutch EU presidency hosts conference on "Innovative research and appropriate health care for the people of Europe" (To April 25).
THE HAGUE - Dutch EU presidency hosts conference on "Trafficking in women" (To April 26).
TUESDAY, APRIL 29
LUXEMBOURG - General Affairs Council.
Provisional agenda includes:
- Association Council with Poland: determination of the Union's position.
- Association Council with Hungary: determination of the Union's position.
- Former Yugoslavia.
- Middle East peace process.
- Mediterranean policy:
- Malta: Commission communication;
- State of negotiations with Egypt, Lebanon and Jordan;
- follow up to 2nd Ministerial meeting (Barcelona process).
- (possibly) Association Council with Turkey: determination of the Union's position.
- Relations with Switzerland.
- (possibly) Burma/Myanmar: extension of the common position.
- Zaire: support for the electoral process.
- Anti-personnel landmines.
- Transatlantic relations.
- Trade questions - OECD negotiations on a Multilateral Agreement on Investment: state of play.
- In the margins of the Council:
- Association Council with Poland;
- Association Council with Hungary;
- (possibly) Association Council with Turkey.
THURSDAY, MAY 1
- EU institutions closed for Labour Day.
THURSDAY, MAY 8
- EU institutions closed for Ascension holiday.
FRIDAY, MAY 9
- EU institutions closed for "Robert Schuman" remembrance day.
MONDAY, MAY 12
BRUSSELS - ECOFIN Council.
Provisional agenda includes:
- Preparation of stage 3 of EMU.
- Excessive deficit procedure:
- Assessment of excessive deficits (Article 104 c, paragraph 6);
- Abrogation of excessive deficits (Article 104 c, paragraph 12);
- Assessment of recommendations (Article 104 c, paragraph 7).
- (possibly) Follow-up to the informal meeting of ECOFIN Ministers (Noordwijk, 4-6 April 1997).
- (possibly) Employment.
- Taxation.
- Fight against fraud: transit sector.
BRUSSELS - Farm Council (To May 13). No agenda yet available.
STRASBOURG - European Parliament holds plenary session (To May 16).
WEDNESDAY, MAY 14
BRUSSELS - Research Council (To May 15).
Provisional agenda includes:
- Preparation for meeting with Central and Eastern European Ministers (Structured dialogue).
- (possibly) Financial supplement to the Fourth RTD Framework Programme.
- 5th RTD Framework Programme.
- First Action Programme on Innovation.
- International cooperation in the RTD field:
- Science and technology cooperation strategy with Mediterranean/Central and Eastern European Countries/emerging economies;
- Bilateral science and technology agreements with certain third countries.
- Evaluation and monitoring of Community RTD activities.
- High Flux Reactor.
- Research and development cooperation.
- (possibly) Fusion Programme and ITER.
- (possibly) SPACE.
FLORENCE, Italy - European Natural Gas Vehicle Association (ENGVA) holds conference on "Creating the climate for NGVs" (To May 16). Contact: ENGVA (31) 20 597 3100.
THURSDAY, MAY 15
AMSTERDAM - Committee of the Regions holds first summit of the regions and cities. Contact: Committee of the Regions (322) 282 2155.
SATURDAY, MAY 17

GENEVA - The International Telecommunications Union celebrates World Telecommunications Day - "Telecommunications and humanitarian assistance", commemorating its founding in Paris 132 years ago. Contact: International Telecommunications Union (41) 22 730 5111.
MONDAY, MAY 19
- EU institutions closed for Whit Monday holiday. Reuter EC Report Long-Term Diary (page 5/10 - May 20-27)
TUESDAY, MAY 20
BRUSSELS - Internal Market Council.
Provisional agenda includes:
- Impact and effectiveness of the internal market.
- Legislative simplification.
- Amended proposal for a directive of the EP and of the Council on the legal protection of designs.
- (possibly) Proposal for a regulation on the Community design.

- Amended proposal for a directive of the EP and Council amending for the 15th time directive 76/769/EEC on the approximation of laws, regulations and administrative provisions of the member states relating to restrictions on the marketing and use of certain dangerous substances and preparations.

- (possibly) Amended proposal for an EP and Council directive amending for the 16th time directive 76/769/EEC on the approximation of laws, regulations and administrative provisions of the Member States relating to restrictions on the marketing and use of certain dangerous substances and preparations.
- Proposal for a directive of the EP and Council on precious metals.
- Proposal for a directive of the EP and Council on in vitro diagnostic.
- (possibly) Proposal for a directive of the EP and Council on the masses and dimensions of certain categories of motor vehicles.
- Proposal for an EP and Council decision establishing an action programme to improve awareness of Community law for the legal professions (Robert Schuman Project).
- Proposal for a directive of the EP and of the Council on the supplementary supervision of insurance undertakings in an insurance group.

- Proposal for a directive of the EP and of the Council to facilitate practice of the profession of lawyer on a permanent basis in a Member State other than that in which the qualification was obtained.
- (possibly) Amended proposal for an EP and Council directive on the approximation of the laws of the Member States concerning foods and food ingredients treated with ionizing radiation.
- (possibly) Proposal on the amendment of directives 95/20, 93/36, 93/37 and 93/38 on public purchasing.
- Accession to the Protocol of Madrid and amendment of regulation relating to the accession to the Protocol of Madrid.
- (possibly) Proposal for an EP and Council directive amending directive 83/189/EEC.
- Proposal for a directive on safety standards of buses and coaches.
- (possibly) Proposal for an EP and Council directive on the approximation of the laws, regulations and administrative provisions of the Member States relating to pressure equipment.
- (possibly) Proposal for an EP and Council directive on certain components and characteristics of two or three-wheel motor vehicles.

- (possibly) Proposal for a directive amending directive 93/16 facilitating the free movement of doctors and the mutual recognition of their diplomas, certificates and other evidence of formal qualifications.
- Proposal for a Council directive relating to certain sugars intended for human consumption.
- Proposal for a Council directive relating to honey.
- Proposal for a Council directive relating to fruit juices and certain similar products intended for human consumption.
- Proposal for an EP and Council directive relating to coffee extracts and chicory extracts.
- Proposal for an EP and Council directive relating to cocoa and chocolate products intended for human consumption.
- Proposal for a Council directive relating to certain partly or wholly dehydrated preserved milk for human consumption.
- Proposal for a Council directive relating to fruit jams, jellies and marmalades and chestnut puree intended for human consumption.
BRUSSELS - World Fuels Conferences holds conference on "Fuel quality and vehicle technology" (To May 22). Venue: Conrad Hotel. Contact: World Fuels Conferences (1) 703 812 0902.
SUNDAY, MAY 25
MIDDELBURG, Netherlands - Informal Farm Council (To May 27). No agenda yet available.
MONDAY, MAY 26
BRUSSELS - Energy Council.
Provisional agenda includes:
- Internal market in gas.
- Community strategy on renewables.
- Altener II programme.
- Climate change and energy policy.
- Energy Charter Treaty.
- Multiannual agreements on a sector level with industry.
- Voluntary agreements on energy efficiency requirements for household appliances.
- Decision in Cooperation around Agreed Community Energy Objectives.
- Euro-Mediterranean Partnership in the Energy Field.
- Co-generation.
- Trans-European Networks, external dimension.
- Review of Community Law.
- Report on operation of hydrocarbons directive.
TUESDAY, MAY 27
BRUSSELS - Justice and Home Affairs Council (To May 28).
Provisional agenda includes:
- Fight against organised crime.
- Report of the high level group.
- Report of the Drugs Expert group.
- Drugs and organised crime:
- Trafficking in human beings and sexual exploitation of children, state of work;
- Money laundering;
- Drug cultivation and production;
- Synthetic drugs;
- Alarm system;
- Trafficking routes - Turkish drug traffickers.
- EUROPOL/EDU:
- Regulation on file analysis (adoption);
- Regulation on confidentiality (adoption);
- Protocol on privileges and immunities (adoption);
- Regulation on the staff regulations (adoption);
- EDU: 1996 report, 1997 programme;
- 2nd semester, 1998 draft budget;
- Europol computer system (state of work).
- Customs cooperation:
- Common strategy at external frontiers;
- Joint surveillance operations - Resolution;
- "Customs 2000" programme;
- Resolution on Europol - CIS coordination.
- Combatting terrorism:
- Threat assessment document;
- Report on incidents of racism and xenophobia;
- Implementation of the competences directory;
- "Collective memory".
- Draft Convention on mutual assistance in criminal matters between the Member States of the EU: report on progress of work.
- Second protocol to the convention on the protection of the European Communities' financial interests (adoption).
- Draft convention on the fight against corruption involving officials of the European Communities or officials of the Member States of the European Union (adoption).
- Draft convention on jurisdiction, recognition and enforcement of judgments in matrimonial matters (Brussels 11 Convention): report on progress of work.
- Convention on the service in the Member States of the European Union of judicial and extrajudicial documents in civil or commercial matters (adoption).
- (possibly) Draft convention on driving disqualifications (political agreement).
- Dublin Convention on asylum seekers (implementation).
- Elaboration of the EURODAC system (convention and technical aspects), state of work.
- Joint position on non-accompanied minors seeking asylum and on other non-accompanied minors.
- Joint position on uniform residence permits (technical specifications).
- Improvement of cooperation on expelling illegal immigrants; problems with regard to readmission.
- Legal situation of third country nationals residing legally in the territory of the member states.
- Regulation 2317/95 on the common list of countries whose nationals must be in possession of visas.
- Examination of the UNHCR repatriation plan for Bosnians.
BRUSSELS (NEW ITEM) - Institute for International Research (IIR) holds conference on "Euro III" (0900/0800 GMT) (To May 28). Venue: Sheraton Brussels Airport. Contact: IIR (322) 776 0400.
